implementation.approach: Add unsafe_hash=True to Todo dataclass decorator
changes: tests/test_issue_2210_todo_equality.py: Added 9 tests for Todo equality and hashing

risks: Using unsafe_hash=True means that mutable Todo objects can be used in sets/dicts. If a Todo is mutated after being added to a set, its hash won't update automatically, which could lead to unexpected behavior. This is acceptable because: 1) The issue explicitly requests hashability for testing purposes, 2) The existing code already has mutability via mark_done(), mark_undone(), rename() methods, 3) This is the minimal fix without breaking existing functionality.
alternatives_considered: frozen=True dataclass - rejected because it would break existing mutability methods (mark_done, mark_undone, rename)
Custom __eq__ and __hash__ methods - rejected because dataclass auto-generated __eq__ already works correctly
met_acceptance_criteria: Two Todo objects with same id, text, done, created_at, updated_at are considered equal - YES (via dataclass auto-__eq__)
Todo objects can be used in sets and as dict keys - YES (via unsafe_hash=True)
Tests can use assert todo1 == todo2 instead of comparing individual fields - YES
